Interface ec.ez.collect.Tuple

public interface Tuple
extends Mapping
A Tuple is a Mapping whose keys are exactly the integers from 0 to size()-1

add(Tuple)
Return a new Tuple consisting of this Tuple's values followed by 'other's values.
asArray()
XXX Ad hockery For supporting coercions
index(int)
For the EZ programmer, this is synonymous with 'get'.
slice(int, int)
Returns the portion of this Tuple's values starting at key 'start' and going up till key 'bound'.

index 
 public abstract Object index(int key) throws NotFoundException
For the EZ programmer, this is synonymous with 'get'. Provided as a convenience for the Java programmer.

slice 
 public abstract Tuple slice(int start,
                             int bound) throws NotFoundException
Returns the portion of this Tuple's values starting at key 'start' and going up till key 'bound'. If 'bound' is the same as 'size()', it is all the Tuple's values starting at key 'start'.

add 
 public abstract Tuple add(Tuple other)
Return a new Tuple consisting of this Tuple's values followed by 'other's values. It has this peculiar name so that EZ's "+" operator will invoke it.

asArray 
 public abstract Object[] asArray()
XXX Ad hockery For supporting coercions
